markets.description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for February 23 at 9:00 PM ET:

If the Utah Jazz win, the market will resolve to “Jazz”.

If the Oklahoma City Thunder win, the market will resolve to “Thunder”.

If the game is not completed by April 16, 2023 (11:59:59 PM ET), the market will resolve 50-50
markets.question: NBA: Utah Jazz vs. Oklahoma City Thunder 2023-02-23

markets.description:
LeBron James is 36 points away from surpassing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar to claim the National Basketball Association's (NBA's) all time scoring record. The NBA's all-time scoring record list can be viewed here: https://www.nba.com/news/lebron-james-scoring-tracker.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Lakers player LeBron James breaks the all time NBA record for most points scored (i.e. a total of 38,388 or more) during the Los Angeles Lakers game against the Oklahoma City Thunder on February 7, 2023, 10:00 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If this game starts on February 7 but extends into February 8, and LeBron James beats the record at that point, this market will still resolve to "Yes". If this game is postponed to a later date or cancelled, this market will resolve to "No". 

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NBA, including live footage from the game, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.
markets.question: Will LeBron break the scoring record during the Feb 7 game vs. OKC?

markets.description:
This market refers to 2024 NBA Cup Final between the Oklahoma City Thunder and the Milwaukee Bucks.

This market will resolve to "OKC" if the Oklahoma City Thunder win this game against the Milwaukee Bucks by 5 or more points. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "MIL."

If the game is not completed by December 31, 2024 (11:59 PM ET), the market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NBA; however, a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
markets.question: Will the Thunder beat the Bucks by 5 or more points?
